name: Hoi An Hotel

reviews.title: Colonial splendour a lovely place to stay
reviews.text: What a cracking hotel! Set in its own grounds the main building is quite grand. The rooms are huge with wood panelling and large windows giving a great sense of a colonial past. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The pool is large and the surrounding area pleasant. You can eat inside of out. The outdoor terrace are is extensive set amid trees. The food was af good quality too. It stands on a main road however the front 'garden' is large enough to give a sense of being away from the traffic. My room overlooked the pool and this would be worth requesting I suspect. Not far to walk into the heart of the town, shops, markets and restaurants.

reviews.title: good location, nice grounds, well kept hotel
reviews.text: I stayed here recently for a couple of days and enjoyed it. The hotel in right in town,although off to the side away from the river, but in town. It has a nice pool area that is great at the time of day that is crazy hot. We tried to get into the Ha An and had to book here but we were happy with this hotel. They have shuttle that runs you out to the sister hotel at the beach.

reviews.title: a State hotel - with some charm
reviews.text: This is a large hotel and state run - booked by our tour agent. I wasn't expecting much - but it actually had a nice kind of charm. All the staff were very helpful and attentive. The breakfast was very good too - nice selection of fresh fruits and the usual East and West choices - ate outside on the tree shaded patio - which was quite pleasant in the early morning.

reviews.title: A hotel with a lot of charm
reviews.text: This is not a 5 star place - but our very large room which at first seemed characterless was made nicer but just turning off the flourescent lights and using the incandescent. Huge bed with foam mattress which was firm and comfortable. Large wooden bureaus -closets which leant some nice character as did the wooden windows and shutters and balcony.

reviews.title: Nice oasis near the center of town.
reviews.text: The only actual downside was the bathroom - which had a high window which opened on to the hallway and so was kind of warm and damp. Noted some mosquitoes when we checked in but they came up and sprayed while we took a walk and that took care of the problem.

reviews.title: Could Be Wonderful
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights, booking on Agoda just before we left Hue. When we arrived, we were told we were being "upgraded". And our room was very nice. However, our room was right on the property line with a construction site on the other side. Work stopped around 5:00pm, just as we were going out for dinner anyway, but it started early in the morning. This wasn't the end of the world, but I think the fair thing would be to discount the room, not claim it was a step up. The buffet breakfast is good, and the pool area is very nice, and the pool large enough to swim lengths. Location is excellent, very central, and just a short stroll to the old town. This hotel caters to tour groups, and they were older, quiet types, and they seemed to be moving in and out at reasonable times (and into the well located rooms, I suspect). A little more attention to detail and this place could be wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a superior room with a balcony and garden view 5 months before we arrived. On arrival we were given a Deluxe Room (a little larger than a Superior) this room was at the back of the hotel with a glassed in Balcony that did NOT have a garden view but a view over a road and the school. The room was clean but we could not lock the glass door onto the very hot balcony (Glasshouse). Maintenance fixed that a little while later. Now the Glass door out to the balcony did not have any curtain or blind so at 5am when the sun came up we were awake. We complained and asked why we did not get the room we booked. We never got an answer to our question. Soon enough they upgraded us free of charge to a Junior Suite. Still no balcony and this time a very modern looking room but not very practical. The bathroom set up was a mess. Water pressure was very weak the shower head was useless and then water spilt all over the floor when you showered. The shower is over the bath that is set very high and hard to get in and out of. Also the hair dryer was not working. Our new room was situated over the lobby area and pool so we had a lot of noise carry into our room and first night in this room we had to phone reception twice to do something about the noise. 1st time at 11.30pm and then again at 1am. Yet another night with limited sleep. All we wanted was a little room with a balcony to sit out on in the evening and a garden view. Exactly as we booked and had stayed in on previous visits to this hotel. So on the whole very disappointing especially when this hotel was the most expensive we had paid during our 5 country 12 week ,30+ hotel trip. In favour of the hotel there are two things. The pool and the Breakfast. Will never stay there again.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Hoi An and Hue are wonderful cities in the central region of Vietnam. There is plenty to see and do in both of these cities. We based in the Hoi An Hotel and did day trips around the area.
reviews.title: Plenty to see and do

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here as part of a tour group. Room was spacious. It was fun sleeping under the mosquito nets. Nice pool area and breakfast was plentiful. Quite a large hotel and very open so you do get some noise with people coming and going with the hole place being tiled floor. Keep you windows shut because of the mosquiotes. Small shop at reception. About a five minute walk to the old town area where all the action is. Was fine for our stay but if i went back i might look for a boutique hotel in the old town itself if there was only the two of us. Mrs Bong's laundry across the road for washing clothes very reliable and fast. Bar inhouse and also at the front of the property. Also 5 minute walk to restaurants. ATM nearby.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: I have stayed at thsi hotel a couple of times previously but now the renovation is complete including all rooms and the reception area. The best thing about the hotel is the close proximity to the Ancient Town. It is only a 5 minute walk away and easy to pop into town for a bit of sightseeing, shopping or a bite to eat. Breakfast is more than adequate and it is great sitting outside under the tall trees.
reviews.title: On the up
Not worth the money
reviews.text: We were looking forward to a stay at the Hoi An Hotel but quite frankly it was a very disappointing experience. For a four star international hotel the service was poor. We took the daily 'free' shuttle to the hotel's sister resort on the beach and were told we had to pay $US5 to swim at their beach when we were dropped off. It's pretty disappointing that we weren't told this in the first place.

reviews.title: Old world oasis in the middle of town
reviews.text: The first room we were in was very old and run-down and extremely noisy. We then moved to another room that was adequate but much smaller.

reviews.title: Love the place!
reviews.text: Like many things in Vietnam, everything comes at a cost and we found this hotel to have quite a few 'hidden' costs.

reviews.title: Nice hotel in a nice town; a nice place place to return to
reviews.text: While these may seem like trivial things, for a hotel that is trying to market itself at international standards, it's not really good enough. The saving grace here is that the pool is just beautiful, and the spa is amazing (staff in the spa are brilliant).

reviews.title: A good hotel within the Old Quarter
reviews.text: Overall though I think you can do much better in Hoi An.
We stayed in a deluxe room over looking the pool and the room was large and clean with a queen bed. The bed was quite comfortable although a bit hard which is common in Vn.
reviews.title: Very good hotel in excellent location

reviews.text: The bathroom was good with good quality toiletries.
reviews.title: Hoi An in Hoi An

reviews.text: There was excellent WIFI in the room.
reviews.title: LOVED this hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast in the restaurant was excellent with great choices.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staff were efficient and friendly and very helpful in finding places for us. The area was large with comfortable chairs/
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our second stay here in 9 years. We stayed for 9 nights, did a deal stay 8 get one free, we paid approx $85 US a night. It has a beautiful pool, however it was so hot and as there is no shade on the pool all day and really no shaded areas around it we didn't swim once, which was a shame. The rooms are lovely and roomy, staff are pleasant, had a lovely few hours at the Hotel Spa which was reasonably priced compared to Australian prices. Breakfast is fine, good selection and gorgeous garden area to dine in. Worth the money, and Hoi An is so beautiful we didn't want to leave.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel close to everything

reviews.text: For what you pay it's excellent! I really enjoyed the breakfast and the mild manner of the hotel customer service. For once during our trip I thought they could be trusted and we were'nt being taken advantage of. good location too!
reviews.title: Decent!

reviews.text: We had booked 2 adjoining rooms with a pool view for our family for USD180/nt so we expected a fairly decent set up, however, when we arrived, we were given 2 rooms facing the road which had a view of a barbed wire fence and the primary school and it smelt so musty that we couldn't spend more than 5 minutes in the room.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We complained and were told that there were no pool view rooms available. My husband went for a walk up the road and found cheaper and better accom and when he came back to check us out, they mysteriously found us pool facing rooms. Even though they were right next to the staff quarters, they were actually quite nice - the air conditioning still had a fairly musty smell though. Also, not a major issue but f you have young kids you'might like to know that the Cartoon channel is dubbed in Japanese!
reviews.title: Watch incorrect information

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool, restaurant staff and central location were the best things about our stay. The driver who picked us up from the airport was also fantastic, he was so good that we hired him to take us to My Son and back to the airport on the last day too.
reviews.title: Convenient location, excellent venue, good service.

reviews.text: This hotel was gorgeous, a real respite after a lot of travelling. The location (between 5 and 10 minute walk from the Old Town) was excellent. The breakfast spread was very good indeed, a good range of items to choose from. I used the spa, which was overpriced but quite good (not very good), and I thought I'd be able to bill it to my room. However, I was then told that I had to pay up front for the spa treatment, as the spa is owned by a separate company to the hotel, which I thought was rather strange; so I paid upfront at the spa. I found that experience rather odd though, and I think the hotel need to sort that out. I would also say that the hotel's perhaps a little overpriced (I paid about $150 per night on Agoda), and I would echo what other reviewers have said about the noice from the school next door during their break times; I am a teacher by profession, so relaxing by the pool, once school break time began, I felt like I was transported back to work!! Not the best. That said, this was a lovely place to stay, if you can afford it (I went massively overbudget by staying here)... it's gone on the credit card for now!
reviews.title: A very lovely hotel, customer service a little lacking at times
Nice hotel, good spot, large rooms
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights, the rooms were very big which was great so we had plenty of room to fully unpack and not be tripping over things.
Had a great buffet breakfast each morning, but the vietnamise chefs need to learn how to cook poached eggs...
reviews.title: Ok but overpriced

reviews.text: Not far to walk to the river and the many restaurants that are very good in hoi an..
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but poor breakfast

reviews.text: Would stay here again...
reviews.title: Top location - rooms need a little more thought!
location location location
reviews.text: What we were expecting , not luxury but very clean , spacious rooom . The first room we had the airconditioner leaked but the serice was prompt and they changed our room within 5 minutes . Umbrellas a hit as it rained most of our time in Hoi An . Zen massage fabulous . Did the cooking class a lot of fun . Freindly helpful staff .

reviews.title: We loved the facilities and location!
reviews.text: We chose this hotel mainly because of its close proximity to the old town and it was fine ( we wern't there much anyway)

reviews.title: Good value, spacious, clean, had everything you needed and well positioned.
reviews.text: On a general note the Hoi An food great . For cheap & cheerful and authentic Bo Bo for a little more eclectic Mango Rooms

reviews.title: Lovely hotel great location
reviews.text: We turned up to this hotel with no booking and managed to get a poolview room down from $90 USD p/n to $55 which we were happy with.

reviews.title: We loved it
reviews.text: The hotel is located within easy walking distance of the main shopping and restaurant area being less than 5 mins walk away. There are also some small shops and a bank right outside the hotel. The room was big with a great view out over the pool and gardens. The pool itself was large and a big relief from the heat. There was also a side area for those wanting to just lounge seperate to the area for actual swimming.
Stayed at this hotel in early September of 2007. Loved the gardens, rooms,meals and friendly staff particularly when relaxing at the pool Location is ideal as it is a short walk into the CBD.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Was so impressed I am bringing back 3 new visitors to Vietnam and made sure that this hotel is on our intinary so will staying here again mid October 2012. Regards Noel Daly
reviews.title: Great location - nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights at end of our 7 days in Hoi an. It's a great location allowing you to walk to everything in town. The staff were friendly but not overly helpfull throughout the stay. The pool area was great and our delux rooms were overlooking the pool. They close the pool at 9.00 which I think is too early if you like a dip before bed as I do. Standard of room was what you would expect but we also had plenty of rooms of the same standard in vietnam for $50 a night instead of $90 as ours was.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: We caught the shuttle to the beach to use the private beach. Very disappointed to have to pay $400,000 for our family to use a towel and recliner!! Our previous hotel was free. So we just wandered down to the other private area where they were more than happy for us to join them especially as we would probably have a couple of drinks or lunch. I think the price for extras at this hotel were very shortsighted as they encouraged you to buy elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Hoi an

reviews.text: It's a 3+ star trying to be and charge more like a 5 star
reviews.title: Eaten alive by mosquito's all night long.

description: Hoi An Hotel occupies lush and spacious grounds in the heart of the old town. It is the ideal place to stay for anyone who comes to visit Hoi An and its surrounding attractions which include the area's other World Heritage sites.
